5.$description: Black at 5% opacity. Extremely subtle overlay.

primary.$description: Primary sans-serif font stack for UI and body text.

secondary.$description: Serif font stack for editorial content.

md.$description: Medium (16px). Base size for body text.

regular.$description: Regular weight (400). Default for body text and most UI elements.

medium.$description: Medium weight (500). For emphasis, labels, and navigation items.

semibold.$description: Semibold weight (600). For subheadings and strong labels.

bold.$description: Bold weight (700). For headings, strong emphasis, and CTAs.

tight.$description: Tight (1.10). For headings and compact single-line text.

snug.$description: Snug (1.25). For subheadings and compact text blocks.

normal.$description: Normal (1.5). Default for body text and most UI elements. Optimal readability.

tight.$description: Tight letter spacing (-0.02em). Use for large headings to create compact typography.

normal.$description: Normal letter spacing (0em). Default for most text.

wide.$description: Wide letter spacing (0.05em). Use for uppercase text and labels.

mobile.$description: Mobile breakpoint (320px). Minimum supported device width.

tablet.$description: Tablet breakpoint (768px). iPad and tablet devices.

desktop.$description: Desktop breakpoint (1024px). Standard laptop and desktop screens.

wide.$description: Wide desktop breakpoint (1280px). Large monitors and high-resolution displays.

0.$description: Zero spacing. Used for removing gaps.

1.$description: Smallest spacing unit (4px). Tight spacing for compact layouts.

2.$description: Base spacing unit (8px). Foundation of spacing scale.

4.$description: Medium spacing (16px). Default for most layouts.

40.$description: 8XL spacing (160px). Maximum spacing for large layouts.

md.$description: Medium radius (4px). Standard for buttons, inputs.

thin.$description: Thin border (1px). Default for most borders.
